div.p: From Francis Gillen to Baldwin Spencer
Letter 40, Pitt Rivers Museum, University of Oxford, Archives, Spencer correspondence, box 2.

To proof.
I am in the full enjoyment of sore throat, influenza and a general state of depressing stuffiness which recalls vividly to my mind the only occasion, never to be forgotten, upon which I saw Baron V Mueller. Poor old Ernest Giles, the intrepid, ... once took me to see the Baron whom we found swathed in flannel and emitting an odour as of the world of botany in a state of advanced decay ...
There is a printed version in Austn Systematic Botany Society Newslatter, 95, (June 1998), p. 12. Taken from: Mulvaney, J. et al., (eds), My Dear Spencer , Hyland House, Melbourne, 1997, letter no. 40.
